attributes.action: Allow unrestricted work and residency visas for citizens of the commonwealth.
attributes.background: Commonwealth countries such as Canada, New Zealand and Australia have strong historical ties with our nation. Polls suggest all three countries are favourable to the idea, it would help alleviate concerns about mass immigration from countries with dissonant cultural values by offset.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/canadians-support-visa-free-travel-between-some-countries-poll/article29204662/?service=mobile

There are multiple sources that support this, I firmley believe it would ease the discord in our society, also it would provide fantastic opportunities for our citizens to learn about the world and enrich our society. I know it would need to be mutual between these nations but I believe we can start a dialogue, also drop NHS surcharge for those nationals.

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to ignore the "No Junk Mail" and "No Callers" Door signs
attributes.background: The "Junk Mail" and "No Callers"  signs are placed on doors by residents in an attempt to stop the need to deal with this menace. But because there is no legal requirement, the wishes of these residents are ignored, and the rights of the residents to not be harassed in their own home are violated.
attributes.additional_details: This type of law is already in place in countries like Australia, and USA

attributes.action: To scrap the literacy and numeracy tests for those wanting to become teachers.
attributes.background: These tests are preventing future teachers from beginning their training. There are many requirements that need to be met and the schools and universities that provide the training are losing students because of the governments involvement. The training providers don't even approve of these tests.
attributes.additional_details: Last year I was accepted by a school and university. I had completed my degree, achieved the necessary GCSE results, gained 2 years experience of working in education. However, after 3 attempts I failed the numeracy and I am now frozen out for 2 years. After contacting Nicky Morgan's office, I received a reply stating that I am not ready to be a teacher. The questions that are asked are irrelevant to teaching especially when the tests are not relevant to the subjects that trainees want to teach.

attributes.action: Make letter boxes for homeless people or people without an address.
attributes.background: In the UK we have a fantastic welfare system. Our country is one of the few countries in the world that provides help and benifits to those who are struggling to get by, but what about the people that have fallen off that ladder? Well to climb back up as you need an address to apply for benifits.
attributes.additional_details: That is where you come in by sighning the petition you will be helping homeless people regain there stability while they apply for benifits. Therefore helping change hundreds of thouasands of people regain a home and get off the streets for ever!

attributes.action: Offer a free workshop on healthy eating on a budget to all UK residents
attributes.background: Myth; 'eating healthily is more expensive than buying junk food'. Pre-packed food or pre-prepared food can be much more expensive and full of sugars, fats and preservatives than making from scratch. More education is needed to make healthy shopping choices, ultimately improving the nation's health.
attributes.additional_details:
If people are educated on how to read the supermarket price labels of fruit and veg for instance, quite often it is cheaper to buy loose vegetables than it is to buy pre-packed. Educate on how simple healthy meals can be made with very few cheap ingredients. e.g.

Vegetarian tomato pasta dish; home-made total price for a family of 4; £0.89.

If wanting to add meat (Beef mince as an addition) ; Total price £2.89 for 4 servings.

Alternative pre-packed pre-made product, 4 servings; £6.60.

attributes.action: Make polygamy a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: Bigamy is a criminal offence in the UK and it therefor makes no sense for polygamy not to be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Briefing Paper number 05051 dated 6th January 2016.

attributes.action: Apply the triple lock to existing old age pensions up to the new annual rate.
attributes.background: The post April 6th 2016 pensions will be increased by 2.5% (min. per year) of the full amount starting with £155-65. Pensions being paid prior to April 6th 2016 will only be increased by 2.5% based on the basic of £119-30, not on any extras earned by older pensioners by SERPS, NI contributions etc.
attributes.additional_details: The idea of the petition is to make rises fairer for older pensioners after the start of the NEW FLAT RATE OLD AGE PENSION April 6th 2016. The way the government triple lock pension increases will be applied to pensioners entitled to draw old age pension prior to April 6th 2016 could cause them to lose out very considerably, relative to the new flat rate pensioners, in some economic circumstances. Example when the CONSUMER PRICE INDEX is static or falls as in the figure used in the 2016 rise.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to charge 3% tax on second homes   (retain for buy to let)
attributes.background: The Government introduced a 3% tax on purchases of second homes (over £40k) on 01/04/16. This was following a consultation on applying a 3% tax on buy to let properties. They did this to close a loop hole.  However, they haven't considered the consequences, or included it in any direct consultation.
attributes.additional_details:
This impacts you if you have your own home and purchase another property. This could be to help your parents, your children, your siblings, your friends. It has nothing to do with buy to let.

My sister looked after my parents as a single mum for 15 years, but they have both passed. She needs help to buy a home the Government can't provide. I will have to pay 3% tax on that home I can't afford.

Many more people will be impacted.  Please sign this petition.  It will impact you unfairly one day.

attributes.action: Legalise the sale,possession and consumption of hash heesh.
attributes.background: The consumption and classification of hash heesh seem to be less contentious than the questions over weed. Discuss any remaining obstructions to the legalisation of hash.

attributes.action: Give British Transport Police Officer's equal powers as Home Office colleagues
attributes.background: BTP officers have limited Jurisdiction dealing with matters non rail related. BTP officers are trained to the same standards as Home Office Colleagues and often assist in mutual aid scenarios. In order to protect the public, and BTP Officers, this petition proposes parity with Home Office powers.
attributes.additional_details:
The public, when they see a police officer make no distinction between police force. Officers seek to protect the public and this is what the public expects. Having a visible police force with 'second rate' powers risks damaging public confidence in policing as they may not be able to intervene effectively.

This amendment would give security to BTP officers who are acting in the public interest to prevent and detect crime as well as ensuring good order in society.

attributes.action: Provide Prostheses rather than wigs for patients with total hair loss.
attributes.background: For seven years we have been asking our health provider to supply a human hair prosthesis that fits can be washed and styled.  Our GP and consultant are fully supportive but at the point of supply the bureaucrats say NO.
attributes.additional_details: Our dealings with the NHS medical professionals has been exemplary understanding  the emotional and mental strain caused by total hair loss particularly in a woman. However all requests for a proper prosthesis are denied for reasons that are unfathomable.  Example cost ( our proposal costs less ). Not NHS approved, (some trust supply). And of course the you need individual funding committee approval ( they always say NO that's their job, all requests made by doctors and consultants are ignored.

attributes.action: To Make Breast Ironing a Criminal Offence
attributes.background: Ritual involves young girls having their breasts beaten, burnt and massaged in order to stop them developing.

attributes.action: Legalise the importation, sale and consumption of coca tea in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Coca tea is a safe, healthy and natural herbal tea that would be beneficial to UK consumers.

The 2016 United Nations General Assembly Special Session on Drugs (UNGASS2016), to be held on the 19th-21st April, offers the unique opportunity to open up debate on the issue.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please visit the following:

Transnational Institute - Coca leaf: Myths and Reality

http://www.druglawreform.info/en/issues/unscheduling-the-coca-leaf/item/262-coca-leaf-myths-and-reality

APPG for Drug Policy Reform - Coca leaf: A political Dilemma?

https://www.unodc.org/documents/ungass2016//Contributions/Civil/APPG_for_Drug_Policy_Reform/Coca_Report_final_25_Sept.pdf

attributes.action: Bring back Corporal Punishment for heinous crimes, e.g. Murder & Rape
attributes.background: Prison terms are too lenient in the UK and I think only way to deter people committing heinous crimes is to bring back Corporal Punishment

attributes.action: Request worldwide agreement that asylum can "ONLY" be to a neighbouring country.
attributes.background: With all the problems in recent times regarding mass migration it would make more sense for a worldwide agreement that individuals can "ONLY" apply to a neighbouring country, there will be exceptions and each case should be independently scrutinised & prove you will be of benefit to the community.

attributes.action: Introduce topics about gender equality and racial equality to the curriculum.
attributes.background: School is supposed to provide people an education so that they be ready for the 'real world'. What is the point when people aren't educated on social justice matters? The lack of education on racial and gender issues leaves a lot of people growing up with narrow-minded and ignorant opinions.
attributes.additional_details: I know first hand that the majority of boys in school will continue to think it is acceptable to objectify and show little respect to girls. In addition, many of the students will think it is okay to make racist remarks because they don't know any better. There is a platform that reaches these students' minds and can influence their thinking. We need to make it so they won't leave school uneducated on basic respect and social issues.

attributes.action: British Army, Royal Navy and RAF shouldn't ban entry for people with autism,
attributes.background: Autism, Aspergers ect.. shouldn't be an automatic ban on entry to the forces this is something that should be assessed on a case by case basis. All the forces have their own doctors who can carry out these tests. Some not all people with autism would work fine within the forces revise the policy!!!!

attributes.action: Support scrapping the 'lesser-duty' rule to save British steel industry.
attributes.background: The government are stating they are exploring all avenues to help the British steel industry. However, they continue to oppose the EU's attemps to remove the 'lesser-duty' rule which would impose higher levys on chinese steel. We ask that the goverenment helps British steel industry and save jobs.

attributes.action: Compulsory yearly test for secondary school teachers in their respective subject
attributes.background: Secondary school teachers that teach GCSE or A-Level classes should take the respective test in their subject every year and score very highly to ensure that the teaching standards are adequate throughout the nations' schools.
attributes.additional_details: If students are to perform well at school they should be taught by teachers that have throughout knowledge of the curriculum. It would also ensure equality as a student should not be at a disadvantage to their peers if they have a teacher who is not able to teach the curriculum to a satisfactory standard. Failure of the teacher to score highly on the tests they are teaching to should result in intervention and perhaps further training.

attributes.action: Scrap Air Passenger Duty (APD) on all UK flights
attributes.background:
Air Passenger Duty (APD) is the UK Government tax that is currently being charged on all passengers departing from a UK airport. Which since introduction in 1994, has risen by up to 539%.

Abolishing APD would see a significant increase in the UK’s GDP as well as the creation thousands of jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK ranks 137th out of 138 when it comes to air ticket taxes and charges - 2015 World Economic Forum’s Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report.

Only six EU countries levy a similar tax, but with substantially lower rates than those in the UK.

The high charges of APD are severely hindering economic growth in the UK's Transport and Leisure Industry. In order to boost economic growth and improve competitiveness in the market, I urge the UK government to scrap APD.

attributes.action: I would like to see the regulation of Management Agencies for new build flats
attributes.background: I pay a managing agent a large fee for my new build flat. The managing agent has destroyed our sinking fund and charged us an obscene amount for 'changing bulbs' - They have no one to answer to! Millions of homeowners have to succumb to these agencies who are ever increasing service charges.

attributes.action: Make the UK safer place from terrorism.
attributes.background: Allow non uniform police and HM Forces personnel aswell as ex services to be allowed to carry a short barrel weapon assuming they have passed all annual training directives (A.D.T).Terrorism is now becoming the number one subject in our daily lives,people are constantly under threat.
attributes.additional_details: An observation made this week by myself whilst walking through a main line London tube station showed our only defence in London "The Metropolitan Police" looking at the ground constantly whilst on patrol. Is London safe? Who knows when terrorism may occur the main question is are we ready to defend our selfs and others?

attributes.action: All visitors to UK  to require visas before gaining entry, as in the USA
attributes.background: To stop the wrong type of person getting into UK and to stop terrorists getting in.
attributes.additional_details: America has used Visa system for years, it seems to work.  As we share Intel with the States it would be useful here.

attributes.action: Make the AA49 (wolverhampton) 70mph again.
attributes.background: The A449 has scrapped the national speed limit and has been replaced by a 50/60 mph speed limits. I see this as a pure waste of money and a great way to sting motorists with speed fines. I believe that it should be made a 70mph again.

attributes.action: Stop the government from forcing mathematics on children until they are 18.
attributes.background: The government want children to study maths in schools until they are 18. At this age people are preparing to start careers and will know whether or not they need maths to start their career. At 16-18 the focus should be on supporting children's ambitions. People's choices are being taken away.

attributes.action: Reduce number of Constituencies by 20% to achieve savings in Goverment spending.
attributes.background: The chancellor has confirmed that additional cuts are required in his recent Budget. As this must be shared equally, parliament itself must cut costs. Elected MPs should represent larger numbers and areas and be excluded from  having additional employments which may affect their elected obligations.

attributes.action: Remove the Value Added Tax charged on toilet rolls and make them VAT Exempt.
attributes.background: Value Added Tax is currently charged by HM Treasury on the sale of toilet rolls at the rate of 20%. I believe that this should be abolished as they are not "non-essential, luxury items" and are an essential item as are female hygeine products which are rated at 5%.

attributes.action: Set up housing for veterans before they leave the armed forces.
attributes.background: Each year many veterans come out of the armed forces homeless. This means that veterans are living on the streets. In 2013 it was calculated that 9,000 ex-service personnel were found homeless. Ex-service personnel are becoming homeless and it is on the rise.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/9000-ex-service-personnel-homeless-after-2071049

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-13983279 

These are links of news articles of ex-service personnel being homeless.

attributes.action: DVLA to review their policies of exemption circumstances for medical conditions
attributes.background: DVLA legislations states that people who are monocular are exempt from exceptional circumstances in their medical section.
attributes.additional_details: I was born with one eye and head neck and facial disfigurement I had driven for 30 years I was legal to drive until DVLA changed their policies in 2013. The condition is congenital and is a non degenerative condition. Therefore the only change is DVLA policies. The machine (esterman vision test) that DVLA use to assess people's vision for driving was not designed to assess people's ability to drive it was to detect glaucoma. Due to my disfigurement the machine isn't fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Make Parking free for doctors in NHS.
attributes.background: At present every doctor has to pay £1.50 per day parking minimum to park their vehicle to come to work. Monthly £45/- to park in place of work in hospital which should be free.
attributes.additional_details: The argument by government is that more people should travel by public transport but the argument against it is that the doctors have to work odd hours of day and night so they need to travel by personal transport if they have one which is not only more convenient then public transport at odd hours especially but also saves time if public transport is not available near to their destinations also the travel by public transport increases the expense exponentially.

attributes.action: Have a set minimum wage of at least £8.50 per hour for care/support workers.
attributes.background: The amount some care/support workers earn is outrageous considering the things they have to endure each day. Care is an absolute must in the community but struggle to find staff purely because of lack of wages.

attributes.action: Impose a ban on leaving your engine running whilst your vehicle is parked.
attributes.background: 9000 people a year in London are killed annually by pollution, about 4million worldwide and that number is rising.
attributes.additional_details:
People often sit in their cars for many minutes with the engine on, I suppose so they can keep the heating on too, or the radio, without running down the battery.
It should be standard to keep a blanket in your car for such occurrences. Parking outside someone's house and belching poison into the occupant's atmosphere should be considered akin to grievous bodily harm.

attributes.action: Review air quality in all airline planes cabins and cockpits-aerotoxic syndrome
attributes.background: Cabin air quality is a very serious health and safety issue which needs to be reviewed by the government in which to make certain of the passengers safety on board aircraft.. This is so that they're is evidence for traces of oil fumes in the cabin air from the engines. Which is deadly and can kill.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence for this is toxicology reports from high class doctors examining organs for traces of engine oil. Reports in many newspapers have stated that it is a serious matter and has killed before. You are unable to know whether that the air is contaminated with the naked eye so passengers are unaware. This can have worse effects on different people. A review needs to be conducted on traces of fumes in the cabin during flight. Filters should be installed to prevent particles getting in.

attributes.action: Clean slate for juvenile offences commited before 18 years old. A second chance
attributes.background: I believe it's unfair to hold mistakes people make as a minor/juvenile to stay with them for the rest of their life. The DBS filtering systerm is simply not good enough, they have been judged already lets not keep judging them 20 years later.
attributes.additional_details: I feel a more fair systerm should be in place. Low level offenders who have not ever served a custodial sentance should be able to move past their mistakes and not have a lack of judgement follow them for life. I propose if an offender does not re-offend between the ages of 18-21 by the time they are 21 other then DNA and fingerprints no record should be held about the young person in regards to arrests and convictions.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to advertise e-cigarettes on television.
attributes.background: Smoking has long been proven to be dangerous to the people who smoke cigarettes and all the people around them. E-cigarettes has given a rise to new young smokers with the chemical involved being just as dangerous but are still being advertised on telly during the day while children can watch.
attributes.additional_details: Electronic cigarettes are a popular new tobacco product that have still largely unknown public and individual health effects. We should be seriously concerned about the potential health consequences of e-cigarettes. This need becomes more urgent as it becomes more popular among children and young teenagers. We must stop apdvertisement of e-cigarettes before this problem grows.

attributes.action: Make people who claim benefits do  voluntary work/work alongside local council
attributes.background: If people who claim benefits are able to work then they should be made to do something for their money. Why should they sit at home and get money when people go out and work hard and long days for their money? Why should they get it just handed to them and get the easy life without working?
attributes.additional_details: There are plenty of employed who go out there and earn a living why cant people on benefits do something for their money? They don't have time to come in and sit there doing nothing. There routine is get up go to work come in have tea go to bed. The employed don't have time to sit and spend time to themselves because they work for what they have.

attributes.action: Reduce the minimum drinking age of low ABV alcoholic beverages to 16.
attributes.background: The minimum age for all alcoholic beverages is currently 18. This should be lowered to 16 for drinks that contain less than 10% alcohol by volume, in order to teach youths to drink responsibly. This is successful in Germany, where it is legal to purchase low alcohol containing beverages at 16.

attributes.action: Cut F35 orders for RN and replace them with a capable air superiority fighter
attributes.background: The F35 is not capable of being an Air Superiority fighter and would put Royal Navy pilots at a high risk of loss in air combat situations against super sonic soviet era jets with modern avionics packages.The Royal Navy needs carrier based fighters capable of defeating Sukhoi and Mikoyan (mig) Jets.
attributes.additional_details: The F35 is not capable of dog fighting and is not suitable for providing a close air superiority role. It has been beaten by the F16 jet in close air combat situations and dog fights, this aircraft has been built since the 1970's. This shows just how bad of a multi-role jet it is. It is to expensive for what it is and would save the government and tax payers millions by canceling a large amount of orders.These canceld orders should be replaced by the better Dassault Rafale M or F18 Super Hornet

attributes.action: Consider upping the drinking age to 21
attributes.background: This is to tackle the booze culture in this country where young people go out at weekends, get absolutely wasted and then have fights at 3am in the streets.
attributes.additional_details: Most people do like to return to a local pub culture and away from the thousands of bars that only serve to get people as drunk as possible. Also, It would still be a good idea to revert drinking hours back to what we had previously with traditional last orders closing times. After all, it's necessary to manage this problem that we are having in this country. With threatening refugee crisis, it's becoming more and more dangerous to stand by all soft laws should we protect our citizens. Do it now

attributes.action: Make all cyclists responsible for their actions on public roads!
attributes.background:
Why isn't there any compulsory training for cyclists, why isn't there a way of identifying a cyclist?

We want dangerous cyclists off the road!

Help us promote safe cycling!
attributes.additional_details:
Some of these links will explain what we are trying to deal with:

www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3131256/Has-got-death-wish-Incredible-dashcam-footage-shows-idiot-cyclist-riding-no-hands-busy-London-streets-s-busy-TEXTING.html 

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/fatal-crashes-are-cyclists-fault-says-boris-7786179.html 

www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Cyclists-fault/story-27759929-detail/story.html

attributes.action: Abolish PFI contracts in the NHS
attributes.background: The nhs is being privatised and 7% goes to private equaty groups.

attributes.action: Make prenuptial agreements legally binding
attributes.background: Prenuptial agreements are not legally binding in the UK, making divorce a financial burden, rather than an emotional burden.

attributes.action: I would like you to debate security on all schools in the uk
attributes.background: The Jewish community have now put security In their schools and neighbourhood. This must be a very big concern to take such action. This is the world we live in now........

attributes.action:
Referendum to any change from Human Rights Act to 
British Bill of Rights
attributes.background: British people should have their say as to which one they want. That's all the British people who should have the right to decide, and not just the 36% that voted for this government. It was British lawyers that set up the Human Rights Act and it is there to protect us.
attributes.additional_details:
This government wants to take some of our rights away.
1) The Worker's Rights Directive - this will go and allow Employers to make us work longer hours for less money.
2) The Court of Human Rights will go. It would be harder for us to get justice.

These are just two. There could be many more rights that we could lose if the government goes ahead and put in a British Bill of Rights without the whole of the British people decide in a referendum.

attributes.action: Change school admissions for SEN or disabled children.
attributes.background: Because parents find it increasingly difficult to choose a school under another authority even if that school is closer to the child's home. There is not enough done to support patents especially if non of the schools in the child's current LA are suitable or not where you wish your child to go.
attributes.additional_details: My own experience I am having a severely hard time at the minute trying to get my SEN child who should be attending a special needs school in September we are constantly been pushed away from our chosen school from our current LA because it's in the next LA even though the school is more suited to our daughter she loved it there on an open day and it is 1.3 mile away from home. No one from the LA is willing to help despite it being our request of school it's wrong and it needs to be adjusted

attributes.action: Close the Westminster Parliament if Britain votes yes in the EU referendum.
attributes.background: As the European Union would be making all the decisions regarding Britain a national parliament is an expensive entity no longer required.

attributes.action: Make the hosting and running of revenge porn sites a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Although its illegal to upload the photos to the site the hosting and running of the sites isn't illegal meaning nude photos can be viewed by thousands without the owners consent.  This can also lead to vulgar, demoralizing comments.
attributes.additional_details: Anna Richardson did an hour long documentry titled 'revenge porn' where she interviews victims and perpertrators of the revenge porn community.

attributes.action: Stop poaching healthcare professions from 3rd world and poorer nations.
attributes.background: NHS trusts nationwide frequently poach healthcare staff from third world; developing and poorer Eastern European nations. They are doing this to meet the training shortfall in this country and because it is much cheaper alternative to training domestic staff; causing a shortfall in these countries.
attributes.additional_details: The shortfall in the countries from where the staff are poached leaves the local populations exposed to the consequences of a shortage of doctors, nurses and other healthcare professionals. This will inevitably include morbidity and death in these populations. The nations spend a significant proportion of their GDP on training these staff only for them to be stollen by bribes by our own NHS. This must stop.

attributes.action: Make pointing a laser at an aircraft punishable by going on the no fly list.
attributes.background: Too many pilots are having lasers pointed at them as a joke. This can blind them and ruin a career that could be someone's dream job. They have probably spent years training and invested a lot of money. People who do this need to see the consequences. They shouldn't be allowed on an aircraft.

attributes.action: Protect our ageing workforce
attributes.background: With the increasing age for retirement all employers with over 25 staff on site should employ qualified medically trained staff with equipment ie defibrillators ect, and be able to hold surgeries in working hours,so you can have advice and check ups. The cost paid for by government and employers.
